intro: Boechera perennans subsp. gracilipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and limited soil nutrients. Boechera perennans subsp. gracilipes is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds.
